Germany's explanation about not regularly checking the platform for messages conveys a practical reason for limited communication, which is understandable in Diplomacy games. Their response shows clarity and honesty, enhancing the trustworthiness of their intentions.

messages.message: And the moves that got entered were from days ago
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'And the moves that got entered were from days ago'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F MAO - ENG, F PIC S F MAO - ENG, A BUR H, A GAS S A BUR, F WES - LYO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Germany's mention that the moves entered were from days ago serves to provide context and reasoning for any potential delays in responses or actions, demonstrating transparency and a desire to communicate effectively, which can contribute to building trust in their interactions.

messages.message: So let's work something out. I'd love for us to stop all the infighting and make an efg happen
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'So let's work something out. I'd love for us to stop all the infighting and make an efg happen'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F MAO - ENG, F PIC S F MAO - ENG, A BUR H, A GAS S A BUR, F WES - LYO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Germany's proposal to put an end to internal conflict and work towards an EFG alliance indicates a desire for cooperation and stability, suggesting sincere intentions to foster better relations and collaborate effectively, which can contribute to building trust in their diplomatic efforts.

messages.message: That's what I wanted from the getgo
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'That's what I wanted from the getgo'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F MAO - ENG, F PIC S F MAO - ENG, A BUR H, A GAS S A BUR, F WES - LYO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Germany's statement confirming the alignment with the desired outcome from the beginning reflects consistency in their intentions and reinforces trust in their commitment to the proposed alliance, indicating reliability in their communication and potential for cooperation.

messages.message: Juggernauts coming though and regardless of if you are got buffer or not if you let that buffer go down in me and England it'll steam roll you just the same
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Juggernauts coming though and regardless of if you are got buffer or not if you let that buffer go down in me and England it'll steam roll you just the same'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F MAO - ENG, F PIC S F MAO - ENG, A BUR H, A GAS S A BUR, F WES - LYO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Germany's warning about the potential threat of a Juggernaut alliance and its impact on the balance of power demonstrates a strategic assessment and a shared interest in preventing a dominant coalition, signaling a reliable and cooperative approach to addressing common challenges in the game.

messages.message: I'm thinking you want to move to Tyrolia and support Ruhr to Munich while I swing my fleets back south
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I'm thinking you want to move to Tyrolia and support Ruhr to Munich while I swing my fleets back south'.

messages.message: Ouch, England got you good.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Ouch, England got you good.'.

messages.message: I can help you
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I can help you'.

messages.message: You still around? If you don't make a very specific move you will lose 4 supply centers this year. No matter what, you will be losing at least 2 supply centers. It's up to you how much you actually want to stay in the game.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'You still around? If you don't make a very specific move you will lose 4 supply centers this year. No matter what, you will be losing at least 2 supply centers. It's up to you how much you actually want to stay in the game.'.

messages.message: How would like to work together though?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'How would like to work together though?'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ENG S A BUR - BEL, F PIC S A BUR - BEL, A BUR - BEL, A GAS - BUR, F WES - MAO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Germany's inquiry about working together demonstrates an openness to collaboration and finding mutually beneficial strategies, indicating a willingness to engage in productive discussions and diplomatic efforts towards shared goals.

messages.message: Hold on and I'll respond more in full
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Hold on and I'll respond more in full'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ENG S A BUR - BEL, F PIC S A BUR - BEL, A BUR - BEL, A GAS - BUR, F WES - MAO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust Germany. Their request to hold on and respond more fully suggests a thoughtful approach and the intention to provide a comprehensive and detailed response, indicating a commitment to effective communication and potential cooperation in the game.

messages.message: Yeah I'm still here
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'Yeah I'm still here'.If the cicero recommended order for me is: F ENG S A BUR - BEL, F PIC S A BUR - BEL, A BUR - BEL, A GAS - BUR, F WES - MAO. Should I trust GERMANY?
messages.output: You should trust GERMANY. Germany's assurance that they are still present and engaged in the conversation implies a sense of reliability and continued commitment to the ongoing dialogue, fostering trust in their communication and potential collaboration.

messages.message: Well, I'm not actually sure what the orders are going to end up being, but what I can tell you are my current moves so that it can help you plan your defense. I'm moving to Ruhr and supporting myself to Belgium (no use in lying about that). So Ruhr's support, whatever it is, will be cut.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Well, I'm not actually sure what the orders are going to end up being, but what I can tell you are my current moves so that it can help you plan your defense. I'm moving to Ruhr and supporting myself to Belgium (no use in lying about that). So Ruhr's support, whatever it is, will be cut.'.

messages.message: I think it is safe to assume that Munich and Holland supports will also be cut
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I think it is safe to assume that Munich and Holland supports will also be cut'.

messages.message: So my recommendation to you if you want to stay in the game would be to use Berlin to support Ruhr to Kiel.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'So my recommendation to you if you want to stay in the game would be to use Berlin to support Ruhr to Kiel.'.

messages.message: I tell you this with little risk since if you tell England, he'll simply change the plan to one without this key vulnerability
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I tell you this with little risk since if you tell England, he'll simply change the plan to one without this key vulnerability'.

messages.message: Now, you have reason to mistrust me, but the truth is that I have 3 fleets and only 2 armies. I stand to gain the least from continuing to attack you. And my largest concern is a Turkey/Russia or Austria/Turkey alliance, which is where I plan to put my focus. I intend to let England and Russia squabble over your supply centers while I move fleets south to help out Italy
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Now, you have reason to mistrust me, but the truth is that I have 3 fleets and only 2 armies. I stand to gain the least from continuing to attack you. And my largest concern is a Turkey/Russia or Austria/Turkey alliance, which is where I plan to put my focus. I intend to let England and Russia squabble over your supply centers while I move fleets south to help out Italy'.

messages.message: And with Russia taking Munich, your survival means that we could coordinate to take it back in the case of a Russia/Turkey alliance.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'And with Russia taking Munich, your survival means that we could coordinate to take it back in the case of a Russia/Turkey alliance.'.

messages.message: So it looks like you really have given up
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'So it looks like you really have given up'.

messages.message: I know things are looking bleak, but if you are willing to entertain me for a bit I have a plan that might keep you alive, and thus get a slice of the $24 pool for survivors.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'I know things are looking bleak, but if you are willing to entertain me for a bit I have a plan that might keep you alive, and thus get a slice of the $24 pool for survivors.'.

messages.message: Just to make sure you see it- the plan would involve you retreating to Tyrolia and capturing an Austrian supply center
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Just to make sure you see it- the plan would involve you retreating to Tyrolia and capturing an Austrian supply center'.

messages.message: Whatever the case, I highly encourage you to stick it out because that way you'll get paid
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Whatever the case, I highly encourage you to stick it out because that way you'll get paid'.
My response to GERMANY:'So.... ?'.
